articles.description: Ten more coronavirus-related deaths were recorded in Wisconsin, while the number of confirmed COVID-19 cases nears 4,500, according to the Department of Health Services.
articles.content:
MADISON, Wis. (WMTV) -- Ten more coronavirus-related deaths were recorded in Wisconsin, while the number of confirmed COVID-19 cases nears 4,500, according to the Department of Health Services.

articles.title: 60 confirmed cases of COVID-19 reported at Allegan County beef plant - WZZM13.com
articles.description: The cases stem from JBS Plainwell.
articles.content:
PLAINWELL, Mich. Sixty employees from a beef production plant have tested positive for COVID-19.
The Allegan County Health Department (ACHD) says the cases stem from JBS Plainwell, where the virus was first confirmed on March 24, according to data from the M… [+1711 chars]

articles.title: Washington forced to recall 12,000 coronavirus test kits for contamination - MyNorthwest.com
articles.description: The state's coronavirus testing efforts encountered a hiccup recently, with 12,000 test kits being recalled for possible contamination.
articles.content:

articles.title: Wuhan Doctor Who First Raised Coronavirus Alarm Defends China's Secrecy - Newsweek
articles.description: Zhang Jixian told a state-backed television channel that she did not expect the COVID-19 outbreak to be so infectious and to have mutated into a crippling pandemic.
articles.content:
The Chinese doctor credited with first identifying the COVID-19 coronavirus has defended the country's response to the outbreak in an interview with state television, amid international accusations that officials initially tried to conceal the crisis.
